newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian peso ends 6.8 higher vs dlr at 1,071.70.
newsitem.headline: Colombian peso ends 6.8 higher vs dlr at 1,071.70.

text.p: BOGOTA, May 7 Reuter - Colombia's peso ended ended 6.8 pesos higher against the dollar at 1,071.70 on active selling of the U.S. currency by banks and the corporate sector, interbank dealers said.
"The drop in the dollar was going to happen sooner or later because there had been a lot of speculation with the exchange rate this week," one dealer said.

The rise in the peso came in the first trading session after the central bank cut its overnight, 30- and 90-day interest rates by a lower-than-expected 1.0 percent. Finance Minister Jose Antonio Ocampo had been demanding a cut of at least 2.0 percent to help refuel flagging economic growth.

Dealers reported 390 trades for a total of $180 million and said the peso hit an intraday low of 1,078.80 before strengthening considerably on sales of greenbacks by banks, coffee and cut-flower exporters and foreign investment funds.
